<denchmark-h:h2>How to reproduce the behaviour</denchmark-h>
I have a piece of simple code from public tests doc = nlp("Net income was $9 million") assert [t.text for t in doc] == ['Net', 'income', 'was', '$', '9', 'million'] # test passes assert doc[3].is_currency == True AssertionError Traceback (most recent call last) <ipython-input-70-0b36974f0595> in <module>() ----> 1 assert doc[3].is_currency == True doc[3].is_currency # False <denchmark-h:h2>Your Environment</denchmark-h>
Operating System: MacOs High Sierra Python Version Used: 3.6.5 spaCy Version Used: 2.0.11 Environment Information: miniconda

comments.comment:
Thanks for the report â€“ I think I know what the problem is: Since the is_currency attribute was added after the current models were trained, it's not yet present in the models (wihch cache the lexical attributes in their lexemes.bin). In contrast, the following works as expected: from spacy.lang.en import English
nlp = English() doc = nlp("Net income was $9 million") assert doc[3].is_currency == True This will be fixed with the next model release!
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ines>@ines</denchmark-link> thanks for your comment! Looking forward to the next model release. Indeed, it works for your example.
